oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Snow Benefit at the Grand Ole Opry - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of the Hank Snow Benefit Concert at the Grand Ole Opry. The segment is hosted by T. Tommy Cutrer (musician) and features performances by: Melvin Sloan (musician), the Tennessee Travelers (musical group/dance group), Hank Snow (musician) and Kelly Foxton (musician), and the Hemphills (musical group). The recording is from an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: T. Tommy Cutrer; Melvin Sloan and the Tennessee Travelers; Hank Snow; Kelly Foxton; The Hemphills;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) T. Tommy Cutrer introduces Reverend Jimmie Rodgers Snow -- (00:15) Rodgers Snow leads the audience in prayer -- (01:37) Cutrer introduces Melvin Sloan and the Tennessee Travelers -- (02:12) Unidentified tune (Melvin Sloan and the Tennessee Travelers) -- (04:19) Cutrer reflects on the Hank Snow Benefit at the Grand Ole Opry and introduces Hank Snow -- (05:16) I'm Movin' on (Hank Snow) -- (07:44) Snow reflects on the various artists that have donated their time and money -- (10:29) Gonna Find Me a Bluebird (Hank Snow) -- (14:19) Little Children are the Hope of the World (Hank Snow) -- (16:41) Snow praises Cutrer's extensive work -- (18:16) Train Whistle Blues (Hank Snow) -- (21:35) Snow recalls going to school in the cold -- (22:49) Merry Go Round of Love (Hank Snow) -- (25:05) Snow praises the vocalists accompanying him -- (26:04) Unidentified tune (Hank Snow) -- (29:30) Snow praises the accompanying band and introduces Kelly Foxton -- (30:34) Rocky Top (Kelly Foxton) -- (33:08) Crazy (Kelly Foxton) -- (35:33) Unidentified tune (Melvin Sloan and the Tennessee Travelers) -- (35:43) Snow reflects on his upcoming single with Foxton -- (36:34) Check (Hank Snow and Kelly Foxton) -- (39:40) Snow asks the audience to support abused children -- (41:52) Unidentified tune (Hank Snow) -- (44:45) I've Been Everywhere (Hank Snow) -- (47:21) Unidentified tune (Melvin Sloan and the Tennessee Travelers) -- (47:47) Cutrer performs an emergency message -- (48:37) Sloan reflects on the Tennessee Travelers' square dance group, and Sloan introduces the group -- (52:38) Unidentified tune (Melvin Sloan and the Tennessee Travelers) -- (56:32) Cutrer praises Melvin Sloan and the Tennessee Travelers; additionally, Cutrer introduces the Hemphills -- (57:36) He Wrote My Name (The Hemphills) -- (59:42) Consider the Lilies (The Hemphills) -- (1:03:29) Thank God I am Free, Free, Free (The Hemphills) -- (1:06:05) Joe Hemphill describes why the Hemphills choose to sing gospel
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cutrer, T. Tommy; Sloan, Melvin; Tennessee Travelers; Snow, Hank; Foxton, Kelly; Hemphills (Musical group);
